aboutLine1: Welcome to my portfolio! My name is Evan Khalil and I am a recent graduate of the Information Systems program at Örebro University. I am excited to embark on my career as a system developer and am eager to take my first step in the field.
aboutLine2: Driven by an unquenchable thirst for skill enhancement, I see myself as a highly motivated individual. My philosophy revolves around optimizing work processes to improve our quality of life.
aboutLine3: Through my academic journey and practical experiences, I have honed crucial attributes such as attention to detail, critical thinking, and problem-solving - qualities I eagerly want to apply to every project I undertake.
aboutLine4: Within this portfolio, you will discover a collection of my past efforts and accomplishments. Each one represents a milestone in my professional development, and I look forward with excitement to the opportunities ahead.
aboutLine5: If you have any questions or wish to explore potential collaborations, please don't hesitate to reach out. Thank you for taking the time to visit my portfolio - I appreciate your interest.
infoSystemsContent: Gaining knowledge about people, organizations and how to develop technology to support them alongside learning the basics of systems analysis and software development. The program offers courses in object-oriented analysis and design, agile methods, interaction design, database management and programming in C#.
programmingInternetContent: Gain expertise in using C# to program with supportive technologies, establish low-level connections to various servers, establish high-level connections to specialized servers like email, web, and database servers, and ensure security while communicating over the internet.
webDevelopmentIIContent: Learn to build sophisticated web-based systems using JavaScript and PHP for both client- and server-side programming in this course.
programmingCSharpIIIContent: This course is designed for advanced programmers looking to sharpen their skills and develop applications using the advanced features of the C# language and .NET technologies.
computerNetworksIContent: This course provides a foundation in the theory and practice of configuring and securing computer networks, including instruction on creating basic network topologies.
gameDevelopment3D: Game Development - 3D Modelling and Character Animation
gameDevelopment3DContent: A course provides a foundational understanding and hands-on experience in creating game graphics using 2D and 3D tools, including techniques for rigging and animating characters and their movements for digital games.
